OVERVIEW

The programme aims to:

Develop and train human capital with expertise and skills especially in the field of Nano Optoelectronics.
 Increase the standards of research, education, and training in the field of Nano Optoelectronics, which would give high impacts to the society.
 Generate experts capable to contribute to the knowledge acquisition and new technology in the field of Nano Optoelectronics at International level.

Course Structure
The programme comprises 40 units of the following four core courses and two elective courses.
Semester I

Physics and Technology of Nanomaterials (core - 4 units)
Growth and Fabrication of Optoelectronic Devices (core - 4 units)
Advanced Growth Technology (elective - 4 units)
Advanced Optoelectronics (elective - 4 units)
Dissertation I (core - 8 units)

Semester II

Advanced Growth Technology (elective - 4 units)
Advanced Optoelectronics (elective - 4 units)
Dissertation II (core - 20 units)
ADMISSION REQUIREMENTS

Applicants should possess the following:
A. Bachelor's degree in related area
1. CGPA of at least 2.75 / 4.00; or
2. CGPA between 2.50 - 2.74 with the following additional conditions: or
a) Research experience for at least one year; orb) Work experience in related field for at least one year; orc) At least one (1) academic publication in the relevant field; ord) Grade B for major / elective courses; ore) Grade B+ for final year project
3. CGPA between 2.00 - 2.49 (Bachelor's Degree with Honours) with the following additional conditions: or
a) Research experience for at least five (5) years; orb) Work experience in related field for at least five (5) years; ANDc) At least one (1) academic publication in the relevant field; ord) Grade B for major / elective courses; ore) Grade B+ for final year project
LANGUAGE REQUIREMENTS

Not Applicable
DURATIONS

Full time: Min. 2 semesters / Max. 4 semesters
Part time: Min. 3 semesters / Max. 6 semesters
SEMESTER INTAKE

• POSTGRADUATE RESEARCH ATTACHMENT (PGRA)

The applicant must be a registered USM student at a master’s degree (research mode) or PhD with good research progress.
The research attachment is only for Universities / Research institutions with active MOU/ MOA with USM.
Application must be accompanied by an official invitation letter from the intended Institution where the PGRA will commence.
The duration of the PGRA fund is one to three months.
Upon completion, the student is required to provide publication in the indexed journals within one year as proof of output from the attachment.
The publication must be co-authored by the host scientist.
Maximum funding of PGRA is RM4000.
• The applicant must be a registered USM student at a master’s degree (research mode) or PhD with good research progress.
• The research attachment is only for Universities / Research institutions with active MOU/ MOA with USM.
• Application must be accompanied by an official invitation letter from the intended Institution where the PGRA will commence.
• The duration of the PGRA fund is one to three months.
• Upon completion, the student is required to provide publication in the indexed journals within one year as proof of output from the attachment.
• The publication must be co-authored by the host scientist.
• Maximum funding of PGRA is RM4000.
• GRADUATE STUDENT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE (GRA-ASSIST)
A. OBJECTIVES

To attract the interest of MALAYSIAN and INTERNATIONAL candidates to pursue postgraduate studies by research mode at USM, by funding their FIRST & SECOND SEMESTER tuition fees.
To strengthen the research excellence agenda and increase the number of publications in USM by increasing the enrollment of research mode postgraduate students.

B. REQUIREMENTS
i) General

Candidate who has received admission offer letter from USM for studying Masters or Ph.D by research mode, yet to register as a FULL-TIME student is eligible to apply. Application for part time students would NOT be considered.
Open to all Malaysian (Masters and Ph.D) and International (Ph.D) only.

ii) MSc Candidate

Must have obtained a bachelor’s degree with a CGPA ≥ 3.00 OR an equivalent qualification that is recognized by the Malaysian Government.
Preference is given to those who had sent in manuscript for publication in a journal indexed by WoS/SCOPUS/ERA.

iii) Ph.D Candidate

Must have obtained a master’s degree by coursework/mixed mode with a CGPA ≥ 3.00 OR a master’s degree by research mode OR an equivalent qualification that is recognized by the Malaysian Government.
Must have at least ONE manuscript published in a journal indexed by WoS/SCOPUS/ERA.

iv) This financial support would be awarded to the awardee on semester basis.
The awardee needs to apply for the extension before second semester starts. The decision of the extension is based on the research progress of the awardee, at least ONE (1) SUBMITTED manuscript to a journal indexed by WoS/SCOPUS/ERA which, the awardee must be the first student author and the supervisor must be one of the authors in the author list.
v) Supervisor
The main supervisor must have:

at least ONE (1) active (the active duration of the grant must still have at least 1 year from the date of application) and sufficient research grant as Principal Investigator to support the candidate research throughout the candidature duration; or
at least TWO (2) publications in journals indexed by WoS/SCOPUS/ERA as Corresponding Author for the previous year.
• To attract the interest of MALAYSIAN and INTERNATIONAL candidates to pursue postgraduate studies by research mode at USM, by funding their FIRST & SECOND SEMESTER tuition fees.
• To strengthen the research excellence agenda and increase the number of publications in USM by increasing the enrollment of research mode postgraduate students.
• Candidate who has received admission offer letter from USM for studying Masters or Ph.D by research mode, yet to register as a FULL-TIME student is eligible to apply. Application for part time students would NOT be considered.
• Open to all Malaysian (Masters and Ph.D) and International (Ph.D) only.
• Must have obtained a bachelor’s degree with a CGPA ≥ 3.00 OR an equivalent qualification that is recognized by the Malaysian Government.
• Preference is given to those who had sent in manuscript for publication in a journal indexed by WoS/SCOPUS/ERA.
• Must have obtained a master’s degree by coursework/mixed mode with a CGPA ≥ 3.00 OR a master’s degree by research mode OR an equivalent qualification that is recognized by the Malaysian Government.
• Must have at least ONE manuscript published in a journal indexed by WoS/SCOPUS/ERA.
• at least ONE (1) active (the active duration of the grant must still have at least 1 year from the date of application) and sufficient research grant as Principal Investigator to support the candidate research throughout the candidature duration; or
• at least TWO (2) publications in journals indexed by WoS/SCOPUS/ERA as Corresponding Author for the previous year.
• POSTGRADUATE CONFERENCE FUND

Open to students who have attended or will be attending conference (physical/online) as a presenter for ORAL presentation for a period of time.
Applicant must be a registered full-time active research mode postgraduate student of Universiti Sains Malaysia.
All applicants are required to submit their application of the conference with the relevant documents:-

Details of conference (e.g. brochures, pamphlet, details of keynote speakers etc.)
Offer/Invitation letter from organiser (oral presentation)
Conference’s detail (including fee) for physical/online mode


Those already submitted their thesis for examination are not eligible to apply.
Please take note that your funding will be cancelled upon submission of your thesis for examination.
Maximum funding is MYR 1,000 per student within the candidature, subject to the availability of fund.
The official receipt must be submitted to IPS for reimbursement purpose after the conference.
The complete application form (with the school dean’s endorsement) and the relevant documents must be sent to IPS at least 3 weeks prior to conference.

At Universiti Sains Malaysia (USM), we proudly welcome students from over 80 nationalities, creating a truly global academic environment. With enrollment numbers exceeding more than 34,000, USM offers a rich blend of cultures, perspectives, and experiences.
Our multidisciplinary approach to education spans a wide range of fields-whether you’re interested in science, engineering, social sciences, or the arts, our diverse course prepare you for success in an increasingly interconnected world.
Program Sarjana Muda
Di Universiti Sains Malaysia (USM), kami dengan bangganya mengalu-alukan pelajar dari lebih 80 negara, mewujudkan persekitaran akademik yang benar-benar global. Dengan jumlah pendaftaran melebihi 34,000 pelajar, USM menawarkan gabungan budaya, perspektif, dan pengalaman yang pelbagai.
Pendekatan pendidikan kami yang merangkumi pelbagai disiplin meliputi pelbagai bidang—sama ada anda berminat dalam sains, kejuruteraan, sains sosial, atau seni, kursus kami yang pelbagai menyediakan anda untuk berjaya dalam dunia yang semakin saling berkaitan.
Selain itu, kami menawarkan program sarjana muda dan pascasiswazah yang fleksibel di luar kampus fizikal kami, memastikan anda boleh mencapai matlamat akademik anda dari mana sahaja. Terokai bagaimana USM boleh menjadi pintu masuk anda kepada pengalaman pendidikan yang luar biasa!
马来西亚理科大学（USM）自豪地欢迎来自80多个国家的学生，打造真正的全球化学术环境。USM的学生总数超过34,000人，汇聚了丰富多样的文化、观点和经验。
我们的多学科教育涵盖广泛的领域——无论您对科学、工程、社会科学还是艺术感兴趣，我们多元化的课程都能帮助您在日益互联的世界中取得成功。
此外，我们提供灵活的本科和研究生课程，不受限于实体校园，让您可以在任何地方实现学术目标。探索USM，开启卓越的教育之旅！
Anda yang mana satu? / 你是哪一个？
MALAYSIA马来西亚人
ANTARABANGSA国际

Be on the Fast-Track to a PhD from a Bachelor’s Degree

[GRID_TABLE]
Admission Requirements

MASTER
Qualifications (any of the below):
I. Bachelor degreeA) CGPA of at least 2.75/4.00; orB) CGPA of 2.50 - 2.74/4.00 with; or

Research experience – 1 year; or
Professional experience in related field- 1 year; or
One(1) academic publication in related field; or
Grade B for major/ elective courses; or
Grade B+ for final year project.

C) CGPA of 2.00 - 2.49/4.00 (Honours degree) with; or

Research experience - 5 years; or
Professional experience in related field - 5 years, AND
One (1) academic publications  in related field; or
Grade B for major/elective courses; or
Grade B+ for final year project.

II.    APEL A Certificate (APEL T-7)http://www2.mqa.gov.my/APEL/ 
For non-CGPA qualifications, please refer to IPS for confirmation.

PhD / DOCTORATE
Qualifications (any of the below):
Master degree (Coursework or Mixed Mode)A) CGPA of at least 3.00 / 4.00; orB) CGPA of 2.50 - 2.99 with; or

Research experience – 2 years; or
Professional experience in related field – 2 years; or
Two (2) academic publications in the field; or
Grade B+ for major/elective courses; or
Grade B+ for Coursework Mode or P for Mixed Mode dissertation/project; 

Master degree (Research Mode)
For non-CGPA qualifications, please refer to IPS for confirmation.
English Requirements

The minimum score for each programme can be vary from the below list, candidates are required to check for each programme requirements.

A minimum of Band 5 for IELTS; or
A minimum score of 40 for TOEFL (Internet-based); or
A minimum of Band 7.5 for TOEFL Essentials (Online); or
A minimum score of 154 for Cambridge English: Advance (CAE)/Proficiency (CPE) /Preliminary (PET) /First (FCE)/ Linguaskill Online; or
A minimum score of 47 for Pearson Test of English (PTE); or
A minimum of Band 107 for CIEP Level (ELS); or
A minimum of Band 3.5 for Malaysian University English Test (MUET)

Exemption CAN BE CONSIDERED to candidate if:

English is the candidate’s mother tongue or National Language; or
Candidate graduated from an Institution of Higher Learning in which the medium of instruction at Bachelor and/or Master degree level is English (statement of proof required)
Fast-Track To PhD

Be on the Fast-Track to a PhD from a Bachelor’s Degree
Eligibility:

Applicants with a CGPA of 3.67/4.00
Passed interview 
Other requirements set by the University

Note: The nominated potential supervisor is compulsory has graduated at least one PhD student.

Grade B+ for final year project.

II.    APEL A Certificate (APEL T-7)http://www2.mqa.gov.my/APEL/ 
For non-CGPA qualifications, please refer to IPS for confirmation.

PhD / DOCTORATE
Qualifications (any of the below):
Master degree (Coursework or Mixed Mode)A) CGPA of at least 3.00 / 4.00; orB) CGPA of 2.50 - 2.99 with; or

Research experience – 2 years; or
Professional experience in related field – 2 years; or
Two (2) academic publications in the field; or
Grade B+ for major/elective courses; or
Grade B+ for Coursework Mode or P for Mixed Mode dissertation/project; 

Master degree (Research Mode)
For non-CGPA qualifications, please refer to IPS for confirmation.
[CARD]
The minimum score for each programme can be vary from the below list, candidates are required to check for each programme requirements.

A minimum of Band 5 for IELTS; or
A minimum score of 40 for TOEFL (Internet-based); or
A minimum of Band 7.5 for TOEFL Essentials (Online); or
A minimum score of 154 for Cambridge English: Advance (CAE)/Proficiency (CPE) /Preliminary (PET) /First (FCE)/ Linguaskill Online; or
A minimum score of 47 for Pearson Test of English (PTE); or
A minimum of Band 107 for CIEP Level (ELS); or
A minimum of Band 3.5 for Malaysian University English Test (MUET)

Exemption CAN BE CONSIDERED to candidate if:

English is the candidate’s mother tongue or National Language; or
Candidate graduated from an Institution of Higher Learning in which the medium of instruction at Bachelor and/or Master degree level is English (statement of proof required)
[CARD]
Be on the Fast-Track to a PhD from a Bachelor’s Degree
Eligibility:

Applicants with a CGPA of 3.67/4.00
Passed interview 
Other requirements set by the University

Note: The nominated potential supervisor is compulsory has graduated at least one PhD student.
